message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SOC

This paper deals with evaluating the quality of scientific news articles using social media and scientific literature indicators. It involves natural language processing techniques to extract information from the articles and social media, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). It also involves information retrieval techniques to retrieve relevant scientific literature, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). The use of social media as a source of contextual information falls under the category of social computing (cs.SOC). The paper also deals with the analysis of the quality of scientific news articles, which can be considered as a form of cyber metrics (cs.CY). Finally, the paper involves the development and validation of a method, which can be considered as a form of computational science (cs.SI).
